You have successfully defended Reeve Fríthild
Brigands in the Wild
Reeve Fríthild is in the Mead Hall of Stoke.\n\nYou should bring Captain Grimmar's recommendation to Reeve Fríthild.
<rgb=#FF0000>Reeve Fríthild has been defeated</rgb>

'These brigands which Grimmar speaks of, are they the same that troubled Oserley and infiltrated Torsbury? Then, indeed, I agree with him. This is a treachery that can only harm the people of the Acres.\n\n'I will gather our companions and ride out to meet these villains. Join us at our encampment to the south of town.'
Reeve Fríthild is at her encampment to the south of Stoke.\n\nYou should speak with Reeve Fríthild regarding the battle.

Reeve Fríthild is at her encampment to the south of Stoke, just off the road on the other side of the bridge on the road to Kingstead.\n\nReeve Fríthild asked you to meet her at her encampment.
'Here they come! Defend yourselves!'

'I am grateful for your assistance, [placeholder], but the time has come for a greater show of strength.'
The Council of Stoke determined that Reeve Fríthild should take to the field and lead her people against their aggressors, but now it must choose what front to focus upon.
Defend Reeve Fríthild
You have successfully defended Reeve Fríthild
Talk to the Reeve of Stoke

'Yet another faithful retainer has perished. Captain Grimmar was the backbone of my garrison... he will be greatly missed.\n\n'We must make the White Hand pay for its treachery! I will return to Stoke at once... meet me there, [placeholder].'

'It was a waste of time and effort -- and a life -- to harry the goblins. Saruman and Mordor both breed them like flies. There is a closer threat that will eat at us like a canker.\n\n'My scouts tell me that half-blood brigands from the Stonedeans are attempting to infiltrate Stoke and sway the people against Reeve Fríthild. This threat must be put to end, or we will see the Dunlendings marching upon this town.'

'Your timing is sound, [placeholder]. We have only just returned from patrolling the area.\n\n'The enemy is indeed present and will be upon us soon. Prepare yourself...their numbers are greater than we imagined!'
